title: Unsupervised Speech Recognition with N-Skipgram and Positional Unigram Matching. (arXiv:2310.02382v1 [cs.CL])
abstract: Training unsupervised speech recognition systems presents challenges due to GAN-associated instability, misalignment between speech and text, and significant memory demands. To tackle these challenges, we introduce a novel ASR system, ESPUM. This system harnesses the power of lower-order N-skipgrams (up to N=3) combined with positional unigram statistics gathered from a small batch of samples. Evaluated on the TIMIT benchmark, our model showcases competitive performance in ASR and phoneme segmentation tasks. Access our publicly available code at https://github.com/lwang114/GraphUnsupASR.

translated_title: 无监督语音识别与N-Skipgram和位置序列匹配
translated_abstract: 训练无监督语音识别系统由于GAN相关的不稳定性、语音和文本之间的不对齐以及巨大的内存需求而面临挑战。为了解决这些问题，我们引入了一种新颖的ASR系统ESPUM。该系统利用了低阶N-skipgrams（最多N=3）和从一小批样本中收集到的位置序列统计信息。在TIMIT基准测试上，我们的模型在ASR和音素分割任务中展示出了竞争性的性能。访问我们公开的代码：https://github.com/lwang114/GraphUnsupASR。
tldr: 引入了一种新颖的无监督语音识别系统ESPUM，利用低阶N-skipgrams和位置序列统计信息，在ASR和音素分割任务中展示出竞争性性能。
en_tdlr: A novel unsupervised speech recognition system, ESPUM, is introduced, which harnesses the power of lower-order N-skipgrams and positional unigram statistics to achieve competitive performance in ASR and phoneme segmentation tasks.
